Article Title: Explained: Why India A's stunning relay catch on the boundary against Pakistan Shaheen's was ruled out
Article Text:
India A vs Pakistan Shaheens (Screengrab)

Mohsin Naqvi Cornered At ICC Meet In Dubai; Asia Cup Trophy Dispute Turns Into Diplomatic Face-Off





A controversial moment unfolded during the India A versus Pakistan Shaheens match in the Asia Cup Rising Stars tournament on Sunday. The incident involved a relay catch between Nehal Wadhera and Naman Dhir that was ultimately ruled not out by the third umpire.India A had set a modest target of 137 runs after experiencing a significant batting collapse.Pakistan A opener Maaz Sadaqat was dominating the chase with an impressive 31-ball fifty. The turning point occurred on the first ball of the 10th over when Suyash Sharma induced a lofted shot from Sadaqat towards deep field.The controversial play began when Nehal Wadhera chased the shot to the boundary. While airborne outside the rope, he managed to flick the ball back into play, and Naman Dhir completed what appeared to be a valid relay catch inside the field.Maaz Sadaqat had already started walking back, assuming he was dismissed. However, the on-field umpires asked him to wait for the third umpire's decision.The decision displayed as "Not out" on the screen left the Indian players stunned. Captain Jitesh Sharma immediately sought clarification from the officials regarding the ruling.Watch:The decision was based on a significant boundary fielding rule change announced by the MCC in June 2025.The amendment to Law 19.5.2 addressed confusion around airborne relay attempts and multiple touches outside the field of play.The previous rule only considered the first fielder's position and grounding. This allowed multiple airborne relay touches outside the boundary.The updated law now requires all fielders who touch the ball to meet specific grounding requirements. A fielder can touch the ball once while airborne outside the boundary but must land inside the field and remain there until the ball becomes dead.According to Sub-Clause 19.5.2.1, when a fielder touches the ball while airborne outside the rope and then lands outside, the ball is automatically considered a boundary.In this case, because Wadhera’s first contact after touching the ball occurred outside the boundary line, the dismissal was disallowed.The controversy deepened when neither a six nor a single run was awarded to Pakistan Shaheens on the delivery, as no batters crossed the crease.Taking advantage of this fortunate decision, Sadaqat guided Pakistan Shaheens to a convincing eight-wicket victory. This win secured Pakistan Shaheens a place in the semi-final.
Article Summary: Controversial moment unfolded during the India A versus Pakistan Shaheens match in the Asia Cup Rising Stars tournament. Incident involved a relay catch between Nehal Wadhera and Naman Dhir that was ultimately ruled not out by the third umpire. India A had set a modest target of 137 runs after experiencing a significant batting collapse.

Article Title: Rising Stars Asia Cup: Pakistan Shaheens steamroll India A, chase 137 in 13 overs; Vaibhav Suryavanshi’s fight not enough

NEW DELHI: Pakistan Shaheens crushed India A by eight wickets in the Rising Stars Asia Cup match on Sunday, chasing down a target of 137 in just 13.2 overs, with 40 balls to spare.India A batted first, and for a while it looked like they might post something competitive. Article Title: Spirit of cricket: India and Pakistan blind teams shake hands after world cup clash - watch
Article Text:
Photo/screengrab

Mohsin Naqvi Cornered At ICC Meet In Dubai; Asia Cup Trophy Dispute Turns Into Diplomatic Face-Off





India beat Pakistan by eight wickets in a Women’s T20 World Cup for the Blind match at the Katunayake BOI Grounds in Colombo on Sunday. India chased 136 for the loss of two wickets in 10 overs, registering their fifth straight win of the tournament.Pakistan, in their second match of the event, were all out for 135 after their top order fell to 23 for 4. Mehreen Ali made 66 and Bushra Ashraf scored 44 to lift the total, but India produced seven run-outs in the innings.In the chase, India moved quickly. Captain Deepika TC scored 45 and Anekha Devi remained unbeaten on 64. Anekha’s knock earned her the Player of the Match award as India qualified for the semifinals.Away from the result, the match saw players from both sides shake hands, setting aside the wider tensions between the two countries. India and Pakistan’s blind teams greeted each other after the match, even though there was no handshake at the toss.Blind women from both countries shook hands in Sri Lanka in contrast to their senior sides, who have avoided handshakes in recent tournaments. Watch video The Indian men's team had refused to shake hands with Pakistan during the Asia Cup in September. That stance was later seen in the women’s World Cup and again at Sunday’s Rising Stars Asia Cup match in Doha.On Sunday, however, the blind women’s teams not only shook hands at the end of the match but also travelled to the venue together in the same bus and exchanged compliments.Pakistan captain Nimra Rafique congratulated India, while India captain TC Deepika said Pakistan had played well. Both teams applauded each other but were not allowed to speak to the media.Blind cricket is played with a white plastic ball filled with ball bearings to help players locate it by sound. Each team fields at least four completely blind players, three players who can see up to two metres, and four partially sighted players who can see up to around six metres. Batters who are totally blind can have a partially sighted runner, and bowling is underarm.Australia, Nepal, Sri Lanka and the US are also part of the tournament, which started in India before shifting to Sri Lanka for the final stages. The final will be played next Sunday in Colombo.
Article Summary: India beat Pakistan by eight wickets in a Women’s T20 World Cup for the Blind match. India chased 136 for the loss of two wickets, registering their fifth straight win of the tournament. Pakistan, in their second match of the event, were all out for 135 after their top order fell to 23 for 4.

Article Title: PAK vs SL: Pakistan complete 3–0 ODI series sweep over Sri Lanka
Article Text:
Pakistan won the 3 day ODI series against Sri Lanka. (Credit: AP Photo/Anjum Naveed)

In a gripping One-Day International clash, Pakistan capped off their dominant ODI series against Sri Lanka with a commanding six-wicket victory in the third and final match at Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium, sealing a comprehensive 3–0 clean sweep. After winning the toss and opting to bowl first, Pakistan restricted Sri Lanka to 211 all out in 45.2 overs.Key Sri Lankan contributions came from Sadeera Samarawickrama (48), Kusal Mendis (34), and Pavan Rathnayake (32), but Pakistan's disciplined bowling attack led by Mohammad Wasim Jr. (3/47), Haris Rauf (2/38), and Faisal Akram (2/42) prevented the hosts from building momentum.Chasing a modest target, Pakistan showcased confidence and composure. Fakhar Zaman provided a brisk start with 55 off 45 balls, while Mohammad Rizwan anchored the innings with an unbeaten 61 off 92 deliveries. Hussain Talat’s steady 42 not out ensured Pakistan crossed the finish line comfortably with 32 balls to spare, ending on 215 for 4. Sri Lanka’s bowling attack struggled to break important partnerships, with Jeffrey Vandersay being the pick with 3/42.Haris Rauf's consistent wicket-taking throughout the series earned him the Player of the Series award, while Mohammad Wasim Jr.'s performance got him the Player of the Match award. The win not only gave Pakistan a morale boost ahead of the next fixture but also extended their solid run in limited-overs cricket.
Article Summary: Pakistan beat Sri Lanka by six wickets to win 3-0 ODI series. Pakistan bowled Sri Lanka out for 211 in 45.2 overs in Rawalpindi. Fakhar Zaman and Mohammad Rizwan top scored with 55 and 61 respectively. Hussain Talat scored 42 not out as Pakistan finished on 215 for 4.

Article Title: 'He will deliver in future': Gautam Gambhir backs Indian batter after Kolkata Test defeat
Article Text:
Rishabh Pant. (Credit: AP Photo/Aijaz Rahi)

'When you don't play well, this is what happens': Gautam Gambhir reacts to 1st Test defeat, points out what India lacked

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!





India's head coach Gautam Gambhir defended wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant 's performance after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. India failed to chase a target of 124 runs in the fourth innings, getting bowled out for 93, with stand-in captain Pant scoring 27 and 2 in his comeback match after recovering from a foot injury.The defeat gave South Africa a 1-0 lead in the two-match series, with regular captain Shubman Gill missing due to a neck injury."From Rishabh's point of view, he's a world-class batter in this format. He plays in a certain way. He can take the game away as well. And we'll keep backing him to play this way as well because sometimes you've got to tell people to play the natural game and, more importantly, be a little smart as well. So, I think he's playing after a long time and I'm sure he will deliver in future," Gambhir told reporters.The loss marked India's first defeat at Eden Gardens since December 2012 against England.South African spinner Simon Harmer played a crucial role in the victory, claiming eight wickets across both innings, while captain Temba Bavuma contributed with a vital half-century.In India's failed chase, Harmer took 4 wickets for 21 runs, while Keshav Maharaj claimed 2 wickets for 15 runs. Marco Jansen also struck crucial blows by dismissing both Indian openers, finishing with figures of 2 for 15.The second Test of the series is scheduled to take place on November 22 at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati, where India will look to level the series.
Article Summary: Gautam Gambhir defends wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant after India's loss to South Africa in the first Test at Eden Gardens, Kolkata. India failed to chase a target of 124 runs in the fourth innings, getting bowled out for 93. South Africa took a 1-0 lead in the two-match series.

Article Title: Rising Stars Asia Cup: Vaibhav Suryavanshi turns up the heat with 45 off 28 against Pakistan Shaheens
Article Text:
Vaibhav Suryavanshi (File photo/GettyImages)

A Father's Pride: How RR, Dravid & Vikram Shaped Vaibhav Suryavanshi





Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi put the Pakistan Shaheens' bowling attack under pressure on Sunday, scoring 45 off 28 balls in the Rising Stars Asia Cup match in Doha.He made 45 off 28 balls, a short innings but one that kept the bowlers guessing. Four boundaries, three sixes, strike rate over 160 — the kind of tempo he has been carrying all week.The young left-hander was out, caught in long-on in the 10th over when he was batting on 45. The left-hander fell in the 10th over. He had already hit a four and a six in Sufiyan Muqeem’s over, and then tried to take on the bowler again. This time, the ball went to Mohammad Faiq at long-on. Pakistan A, led by Irfan Khan, beat hosts Oman by 40 runs in the tournament’s opening match on Friday, shortly before India A registered a big win over the UAE.

Article Title: IND A vs SA A: Harshit Rana, Nishant Sindhu rip through South Africa A; Ruturaj Gaikwad finishes job as India A cruise to 9-wicket win

India A secured a commanding nine-wicket victory against South Africa A in the second unofficial ODI on Sunday, taking an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Ruturaj Gaikwad 's unbeaten 68 and Harshit Rana's three-wicket haul were the highlights of the match.The Indian bowlers dominated the game as Rana and left-arm spinner Nishant Sindhu combined to restrict South Africa A to 132 runs in 30.3 overs. Article Title: No handshake! India A skip handshakes with Pakistan Shaheens at Rising Stars Asia Cup
Article Text:
India A captain Jitesh Sharma

Mohsin Naqvi Cornered At ICC Meet In Dubai; Asia Cup Trophy Dispute Turns Into Diplomatic Face-Off





At the Rising Stars Asia Cup in Doha on Sunday, the India A vs Pakistan Shaheens match began with no handshake between the two teams after the national anthems. The India A team did not shake hands with Pakistan Shaheens, continuing the pattern seen earlier this year when the senior Indian team avoided handshakes with Pakistan players throughout the Asia Cup — neither at the toss nor after any of the three matches.Pakistan Shaheen's won the toss, and elected to bowl first. Follow live updates

During the Asia Cup in September, the Indian senior team avoided handshakes with Pakistan’s players in all three matches between the sides, including in the final. There was no handshake at the toss or after the games, and the same approach now appears to have carried into the Rising Stars tournament.The gesture, or lack of it, has again drawn attention to how both teams manage interactions in ICC and ACC events, especially at a time when bilateral cricket between the two countries remains suspended.The Asia Cup tournament had been fraught with tension from the very start, and the animosity carried into the final, which India won by five wickets.What started with India's refusal to shake hands to show solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack and the armed forces, descended into a full blown mocking match in the summit clash.The presentation ceremony got over an hour late without the champions laying their hands on the trophy as PCB chief and ACC chairperson Naqvi had walked away with it.The tension between the two sides had been palpable throughout the tournament.
Article Summary: India A vs Pakistan Shaheens match began with no handshake after national anthems. Senior Indian team avoided handshakes with Pakistan players during Asia Cup. Tension between the two sides had been palpable throughout the tournament. India won the final by five wickets, but presentation ceremony was delayed.

Article Title: IND vs SA: 'Can't call ourselves top Test side' - Ex-cricketers hit out after India’s defeat in Kolkata
Article Text:
Ravindra Jadeja walks off after his dismissal during the third day of the first Test cricket match of series between India and South Africa, at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. (PTI Photo)

'We need to determine how he got it': Morne Morkel on Shubman Gill's injury & pitch quality at Eden Gardens





Former India cricketers reacted strongly after the team’s 30-run loss to South Africa at Eden Gardens, a match in which India could not chase 124. The defeat has reopened questions about selections, planning and India’s struggles on turning pitches.Former cricketer Irfan Pathan said India’s ability to play spin has reduced over time."Skills to play spin on turning tracks around the world have definitely gone down, but this kind of batting from India shows how much our own ability has dropped too. Soft hands, wrist work, all of it has declined drastically," Pathan said on X.Wasim Jaffer said India have not corrected mistakes seen in earlier defeats."Looks like we haven't learned our lesson from NZ (New Zealand) series loss. The gap between our spinners and opposition spinners reduces on pitches like this. We need to go back to classic Indian pitches, like the ones in the 2016-17 season when Virat was captain and Eng and NZ toured," Jaffer said on X.Mohammad Kaif said South Africa used the conditions better."South Africa showed if you bowl well, two spinners are enough to win a Test match in India," Kaif remarked.Venkatesh Prasad said the loss shows larger problems in India’s Test plans."While we have been excellent in white-ball cricket, we can't call ourselves a top Test side with such planning. Selections without clarity and over-tactical thinking are backfiring. Poor results over a year in Tests barring a drawn series in England," Prasad said on X.Former Gujarat cricketer Priyank Panchal pointed to repeated errors in India’s approach."First New Zealand, now this. Preference to all-rounders over specialists. Lack of robust gameplan for home Test matches. Absence of understanding of pacing an innings in the longest format. Performance in flat tracks of England aside, disappointing returns otherwise," he said on X.Badrinath also shared his concerns.Badrinath said, "Disappointing to see India’s batting against spin decline while visiting spinners keep improving with every tour, the complete opposite of how it used to be."
Article Summary: Former India cricketers reacted strongly after the team’s 30-run loss to South Africa at Eden Gardens. The defeat has reopened questions about selections, planning and India's struggles on turning pitches. Former cricketer Irfan Pathan said India's ability to play spin has reduced over time. Wasim Jaffer said India have not corrected mistakes seen in earlier defeats.

Article Title: 'Not giving first over to your best bowler...' - Anil Kumble questions India's strategy
Article Text:
India's Jasprit Bumrah on match between India and South Africa in Kolkata, India. (Credit: AP/PTI(AP11_16_2025_000018B)

'Control your temptations': Jasprit Bumrah reacts after stunning fifer against South Africa in 1st Test

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!





India suffered a 30-run defeat against South Africa in the opening Test at Eden Gardens on Sunday, with former cricket legend Anil Kumble criticizing India's decision not to give the first over to lead pacer Jasprit Bumrah on day three, as India failed to chase down a target of 124, getting bowled out for 93.India's challenge began with South Africa at 63 for 7, but their field placement and bowling choices came under scrutiny from Kumble."A target of 123 was a bit too much. When the day started, South Africa were 63 for 7 and that was the lead. Temba Bavuma was still there. But having spread-out fields and not giving the first over to your best bowler, Jasprit Bumrah, was questionable. All three wickets that fell were to the fast bowlers," Kumble said on JioHotstar.Kumble highlighted South African captain Temba Bavuma's leadership, noting his impressive record as captain and recent batting performances."Overall, India were certainly outdone by South Africa. Credit to Temba Bavuma — he doesn't get the recognition he deserves as a captain. He has won 10 out of 11 Test matches as skipper for South Africa and has won a Test Championship for them. He doesn't get the kind of credit other international captains receive," Kumble remarked.He further praised Bavuma's batting prowess, particularly highlighting his performances in the World Test Championship final and the current match."As a batter, too, he has produced two quality innings, one in the WTC final and one here, literally back-to-back since he wasn't available for Pakistan. He has done exceptionally well both as a player and a skipper," he added.Kumble also commended Bavuma's tactical decisions during the match, particularly his bowling changes."I thought he did really well in bringing on Aiden Markram when there were two left-handers at the crease. Washington Sundar had a good look at Simon Harmer and seemed comfortable. And maybe that one over from Keshav Maharaj, I felt that was where he got the wrong bowler on, because Axar was certainly taking him on," Kumble observed.He concluded his analysis by praising Bavuma's overall bowling strategy: "But he took a gamble that ultimately paid off. It cost South Africa 16 runs, but it paid off. Overall, I thought his usage of bowlers was excellent. He never used Wiaan Mulder at all in the innings. He ensured that the tall Marco Jansen, Corbin Bosch, and the two spinners along with the smart use of Markram were enough."
Article Summary: India suffered a 30-run defeat against South Africa in the opening Test at Eden Gardens on Sunday. Former cricket legend Anil Kumble criticized India's decision not to give the first over to lead pacer Jasprit Bumrah on day three. Kumble highlighted South African captain Temba Bavuma's leadership, noting his impressive record as captain and recent batting performances.

Article Title: IND vs SA: WTC points table shake-up after Kolkata Test; India slip to fourth, Proteas jump to No. 2
Article Text:
South Africa's Keshav Maharaj with teammates celebrates after the team wins during the third day of the first Test cricket match of a series between India and South Africa, at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. (PTI Photo)

Why Andre Russell will remain hot property at the IPL mini auction

Updated World Test Championship standings after India vs South Africa first Test







NEW DELHI: Team India batters struggled again against quality spin in home conditions as South Africa beat them by 30 runs in the first Test at Eden Gardens in Kolkata on Sunday, their first win in India in 15 years.India were chasing a modest target of 124 but could not settle or build an innings in the way Proteas captain Temba Bavuma had done earlier in the day. They were bowled out for 93 in 35 overs. Shubman Gill, who was hospitalised with a neck injury, did not come out to bat on day three.The pitch was expected to help Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav, but it was Simon Harmer who shaped the match. The off-spinner took eight wickets across the two innings and gave South Africa the advantage.This was India’s fourth home defeat in their last six Tests, including a 0-3 loss to New Zealand on spinning tracks last year. The result has reopened the discussion around how Indian batters handle turning surfaces, even at home.After this Test, reigning champions South Africa moved up to second place in the World Test Championship (WTC) standings with 24 points and a PCT of 66.67. They were fourth before the match, behind Sri Lanka and India.Sri Lanka now slip to third and India drop down to fourth.Teams play three home and three away series in a WTC cycle. South Africa earned points in Pakistan, where they drew 1-1, and now in India, giving them important results in away conditions.This was South Africa’s 10th win in their last 11 Tests as the current World Test Champions continue their run.The series shifts to Guwahati for the second Test starting 22 November. The match will decide the series, and South Africa will try to claim their first series win in India since 2000.
Article Summary: South Africa beat India by 30 runs in the first Test at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. India were chasing a modest target of 124 but could not settle or build an innings. It was South Africa’s 10th win in their last 11 Tests as the current World Test Champions continue their run.

Article Title: IPL: Ex-cricketer says KKR should target this Australian all-rounder at auction; calls him ‘upgraded version of Russell’
Article Text:
Kolkata Knight Riders part ways with Andre Russell. (Credit: X)

Why Andre Russell will remain hot property at the IPL mini auction

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Poll How do you rate Andre Russell's contribution to KKR? Unmatched - he was a match-winner! Very impactful - key player for the team. Average - didn't live up to the hype. Disappointing - expected more.





Former Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra has suggested that Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) should pursue Australian all-rounder Cameron Green in the upcoming Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026 auction, following their decision to release Andre Russell . KKR now enters the auction with a substantial purse of Rs 64.3 crores, and Chopra believes Green could be an upgraded version of Russell.KKR's decision to part ways with Russell marks the end of a successful decade-long association that brought the franchise two IPL trophies. Russell, who was previously retained for Rs 12 crore ahead of the 2025 mega auction, was a key player for the team since 2014."I think one must make an edit of Cameron Green in purple and publish it already. KKR need Cameron Green. They will control the auction now because they have a lot of money. The bowling will not get impacted by (Spencer) Johnson, (Anrich) Nortje, or Russell going away. You have four overs each from Harshit Rana, Vaibhav Arora, Varun Chakravarthy and Sunil Narine. Green would also give you three or four overs. They could also buy more overseas bowlers. Maybe Green could come in as an upgraded version of Russell," Chopra said on his YouTube channel.Russell's contributions to KKR have been significant, scoring 2,593 runs in 133 matches at an average of 28.81 and a strike rate exceeding 175.He also claimed 122 wickets at an average of 21.59, including one five-wicket haul and three four-wicket hauls.Green has shown promise in his IPL career, first with Mumbai Indians in 2023, where he scored 452 runs in 16 innings at an average of 50.22 and took six wickets. He was initially purchased by MI for Rs 17.5 crores.His performance continued with Royal Challengers Bangalore in 2024, contributing 255 runs at an average of 31.38 and taking 10 wickets in 13 matches during their playoff campaign.Green's recent T20I form has been impressive, scoring 258 runs in eight innings at an average of 43.00 and maintaining a strike rate above 168. His bowling capabilities have also improved, consistently reaching speeds of 135-140 kilometers per hour.KKR has released several other overseas players, including Moeen Ali, Anrich Nortje, Quinton de Kock, Rahmanullah Gurbaz, and Spencer Johnson. The team also released Venkatesh Iyer due to his recent form concerns.The franchise has retained a core group of players that combines youth and experience, including Ajinkya Rahane, Manish Pandey, Sunil Narine, Varun Chakaravarthy, Rinku Singh, Harshit Rana, and Angkrish Raghuvanshi.The complete list of retained players for KKR includes Ajinkya Rahane, Angkrish Raghuvanshi, Anukul Roy, Harshit Rana, Manish Pandey, Ramandeep Singh, Rinku Singh, Rovman Powell, Sunil Narine, Umran Malik, Vaibhav Arora, and Varun Chakaravarthy.The team currently has 13 available slots to fill, including six positions for overseas players, as they prepare for the upcoming season.
Article Summary: Aakash Chopra believes Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) should pursue Cameron Green in the upcoming Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026 auction. KKR parted ways with Andre Russell, who was previously retained for Rs 12 crore ahead of the 2025 mega auction. Russell's contributions to KKR have been significant, scoring 2,593 runs in 133 matches.

Article Title: Cristiano Ronaldo set for sixth World Cup as Portugal secure spot with 9–1 demolition of Armenia

Portugal secured their spot in the 2026 World Cup with a commanding 9-1 victory over Armenia on Sunday, ensuring Cristiano Ronaldo 's opportunity to compete in his record sixth World Cup tournament, despite his absence due to suspension in the qualifying match in Porto.Bruno Fernandes and Joao Neves each scored hat tricks in the decisive win against Armenia, compensating for Ronaldo's suspension following his red card in Portugal's 2-0 loss to Ireland on Thursday.Ronaldo, who will be 41 when the tournament begins next June in the United States, Canada, and Mexico, has indicated this would be his final attempt to capture the one major title that has eluded him in his career.The Portuguese star may face additional suspension of up to two matches following his sending off against Ireland, though he is expected to maintain his place in Roberto Martinez's squad if he stays fit.The victory was crucial for Portugal after their unexpected defeat to Ireland, as they needed to beat Armenia to guarantee top position in Group F.Hungary had an opportunity to overtake Portugal for the group lead but suffered a dramatic 3-2 defeat to Ireland in Budapest.Ireland's Troy Parrott secured second place and a playoff spot with a remarkable hat trick, including an 80th-minute equalizer and a winning goal in the sixth minute of added time.
Article Summary: Portugal beat Armenia 9-1 to secure their place in the 2026 World Cup. Cristiano Ronaldo will play in his record sixth World Cup tournament. The tournament will be held in the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Ronaldo was sent off in Portugal's 2-0 loss to Ireland on Thursday.

Article Title: Why is FIFA considering banning Cristiano Ronaldo after first Portugal red card in 22 years?
Article Text: Cristiano Ronaldo faces a potential three-week wait for a FIFA ban verdict after his red card against Ireland. He could miss two or three games, impacting his 2026 World Cup preparations. FIFA rules mandate at least a two-game suspension for serious foul play or three for violent conduct, with bans served in competitive matches.

Article Title: Kylian Mbappé leads the charge as France secure FIFA World Cup 2026 qualification
Article Text:
Kylian Mbappe of France (Photo by Franco Arland/Getty Images)

Ronaldo Drops STUNNING Trump Claim in New Interview: What He REALLY Said | WATCH





France have secured their spot in the 2026 World Cup, with Kylian Mbappé leading the charge. Meanwhile, Cristiano Ronaldo faces a potential ban from Portugal's opening match if his team manages to win their European qualifying group.France achieved qualification with a convincing 4-0 victory against Ukraine at home, highlighted by Mbappé's double contribution. Portugal's path hit a roadblock after a surprising 2-0 defeat to Ireland in Dublin, where Ronaldo received his first-ever international red card.The French dominance continued in the second half as Michael Olise and substitute Hugo Ekitiké added to the scoresheet.At Parc des Princes in Paris, Mbappé opened the scoring with a penalty in the 55th minute. Olise extended the lead with a curling shot in the 76th minute, followed by Mbappé's close-range finish in the 83rd. This brought Mbappé's international goal tally to 55, just two behind Olivier Giroud's national record."The French national team will always be better with him in it. He makes things easier for us. He performed his role perfectly this evening, as both a player and the captain of the national team," said coach Didier Deschamps about Mbappé.Mbappé nearly completed his hat-trick but missed a clear opportunity shortly after his second goal.France lead Group D with 13 points, while Ukraine and Iceland share seven points each, setting up a crucial match for second place on Sunday.Portugal's situation became complicated when Ronaldo received a red card for elbowing Ireland's Dara O'Shea after an hour of play. The initial yellow card was upgraded to red following a video review."I thought it was a bit harsh. He has never been sent off before in 226 games," Portugal coach Roberto Martinez commented on the incident.Ronaldo will miss Portugal's match against Armenia due to the mandatory one-game suspension. FIFA rules may extend this to at least two matches for serious foul play.Ireland's victory came through Troy Parrott's two goals. He scored first with a header in the 17th minute and doubled the lead just before halftime with a low shot.Norway's World Cup prospects brightened as Erling Haaland scored twice in their 4-1 win over Estonia, moving them closer to their first World Cup appearance since 1998.Italy secured a 2-0 victory against Moldova with late goals from Gianluca Mancini and Francesco Pio Esposito. They trail Norway by three points in Group I.Italy face Norway in their final match, needing an improbable nine-goal victory to qualify directly due to Norway's superior goal difference.Haaland has contributed 14 goals to Norway's impressive total of 33 in seven group matches, the highest in European qualifying.England maintained their perfect record in Group K with a 2-0 victory over Serbia at Wembley Stadium, continuing their streak without conceding a goal.Bukayo Saka scored first for England with a left-foot volley in the 28th minute. Eberechi Eze sealed the win in the 90th minute, assisted by Phil Foden.In the same group, Albania secured second place by defeating Andorra 1-0.Portugal currently lead Group F with 10 points, followed by Hungary with eight points and Ireland with seven. The final qualifying matches will see Portugal host Armenia while Hungary faces Ireland.

Article Title: Sports Minister meets I-League clubs a day after AIFF meet boycott; SAI to mediate
Article Text:
Union Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met representatives of I-League clubs in New Delhi on Thursday (Images via ANI, X/Screengrabs)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Poll Should the ISL, I-League, and I-League 2 be managed under one commercial framework? Yes, it will promote parity No, each league should have its own management





Amid the ongoing turmoil in Indian football, Union Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met representatives of I-League clubs in New Delhi on Thursday to discuss their concerns and explore possible solutions to the escalating standoff between the All India Football Federation (AIFF), the Indian Super League (ISL), and I-League teams.The meeting, attended by seven representatives from among the 14 I-League clubs, was also joined by Sports Secretary and SAI Director General Hari Ranjan Rao and Joint Secretary Kunal. According to a senior official present, Mandaviya “gave a patient hearing to the I-League representatives” and urged the Sports Authority of India to mediate discussions going forward for the time being.“The minister gave a patient hearing to the I-League representatives and for the time being instructed SAI to step in and engage with the stakeholders. He wants a constructive dialogue between officials of the AIFF, the Indian Super League (ISL) and I-League,” a source told PTI.The intervention from the ministry comes a day after I-League clubs boycotted a meeting convened by the AIFF to address the deepening crisis triggered by the federation’s inability to secure a new commercial partner.The fallout of the AIFF’s failed renewal with Football Sports Development Limited (FSDL), which had managed the ISL and related commercial activities, has left domestic football in uncertainty.With the partnership collapsing ahead of its December expiry, the 2025–26 ISL season remains on hold, and top I-League clubs, including defending champions Mohun Bagan, have suspended training sessions.The I-League clubs have demanded that all tiers of Indian football, namely the ISL, I-League, and I-League 2 be managed under a single commercial framework to ensure parity and stability.The AIFF’s search for a new partner is being monitored by the Supreme Court, which approved a revised constitution for the federation in October.The ministry is expected to facilitate further discussions between the AIFF, ISL and I-League representatives in the coming days to help break the deadlock.
Article Summary: Union Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met representatives of I-League clubs in New Delhi on Thursday. The meeting was to explore possible solutions to the escalating standoff between the All India Football Federation (AIFF), the Indian Super League (ISL), and I- league teams. The intervention comes a day after I-league clubs boycotted a meeting convened by the AIFF to address the deepening crisis triggered by the federation's inability to secure a new commercial partner.

Article Title: Oscar, who played with Neymar Jr in 2014 World Cup, collapses during training; rushed to hospital
Article Text:
Oscar has played with Neymar Jr in the 2014 FIFA World Cup for Brazil and for Chelsea from 2012 to 2017 (Images via Getty)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Poll Should Oscar consider retiring to prioritize his health? Yes, absolutely No, he should continue playing if possible





Former Chelsea and Brazil midfielder Oscar was taken to hospital after suffering a heart-related issue during a pre-season training session with São Paulo. The club confirmed that the 34-year-old is in stable condition and under medical observation.According to reports in Brazil, the incident occurred during fitness tests on an exercise bike when Oscar collapsed and briefly lost consciousness. He was attended to immediately by medical staff before being transported to hospital in an ambulance.São Paulo released an official statement confirming the episode and the player’s current status. “During tests carried out on Tuesday morning, at SuperCT, as part of pre-season preparation, athlete Oscar presented a complication with cardiac changes, and was promptly treated by the club's professionals and the medical team from Einstein Hospital Israelita, who were present at the scene,” the club said.It further added: “The player was then taken to the hospital, where he is clinically stable and remains under observation for further tests to clarify the diagnosis.”Oscar, who returned to his boyhood club São Paulo on a free transfer last December, has a contract with the team until 2027. He had spent several years playing in China before his return to Brazil.The midfielder was a key figure at Chelsea between 2012 and 2017, winning two Premier League titles and a Europa League crown during his time in England.He left the London club midway through the 2016–17 season to join Shanghai for a reported $73 million fee, becoming one of the highest-paid players in the Chinese Super League.Oscar also represented Brazil at the 2014 FIFA World Cup, playing alongside Neymar Jr, scoring the team’s only goal in the 7–1 semifinal thrashing to eventual champions Germany.Further medical updates on his condition are expected as São Paulo continue to monitor the midfielder closely.There are also reports that the player is considering retirement after his condition came to light. In 2021, Argentina's Sergio Aguero called time on his career after heart related issues after joining Barcelona on a free transfer from Manchester City.
Article Summary: Oscar was taken to hospital after suffering a heart-related issue during a pre- season training session with São Paulo. The club confirmed that the 34-year-old is in stable condition and under medical observation. According to reports in Brazil, the incident occurred during fitness tests on an exercise bike when Oscar collapsed.

Article Title: 'Boo me, please': Cristiano Ronaldo's cheeky message to Ireland fans before World Cup clash
Article Text:
Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo (AP Photo/Armando Franca)





Portuguese superstar Cristiano Ronaldo has urged Ireland fans to boo him when Portugal take the field in Thursday’s World Cup qualifier in Dublin. Speaking at a press conference on Wednesday, the 40-year-old said he hoped the home supporters’ focus on him might ease the pressure on his teammates as Portugal look to secure qualification for the 2026 World Cup.“The stadium will boo me, I’m used to it, I certainly hope they do — maybe it will take the pressure off other players,” Ronaldo told reporters in Dublin. Portugal sit five points clear at the top of Group F with two games left, and a win over Ireland would seal their spot in next year’s World Cup. Ronaldo, who is aiming to feature in his sixth edition of the tournament, said he expects a tough contest against an Irish side that will likely defend deep.“It will be a difficult match,” he said. “Ireland will sit back and make it hard for us to find space.”The Al Nassr forward was also asked about the possibility of scoring his 1000th career goal in the World Cup final, which he dismissed with a laugh. “You’ve been watching too many movies, that would be too perfect,” Ronaldo joked. “It’s always good to score goals — that’s my job. I want to play in this next World Cup, otherwise I wouldn’t be here, but let’s take it step by step.”Ronaldo has scored 953 career goals and holds the record for the most goals in men’s international football with 143. While he hinted earlier this week that the 2026 World Cup could be his last, Ronaldo chose not to dwell on his future this time.“There’s no point in being repetitive and losing focus,” he said. “Maybe later I’ll speak more clearly about what I think for the future, but right now, the goal is qualification.”
Article Summary: Cristiano Ronaldo has urged Ireland fans to boo him when Portugal take the field in Thursday's World Cup qualifier in Dublin. Portugal sit five points clear at the top of Group F with two games left, and a win over Ireland would seal their spot in next year’s World Cup. Ronaldo hinted earlier this week that the 2026 World Cup could be his last.

Article Title: AIFF press SOS button: ISL clubs answer call, I-League clubs press reject
Article Text:
File photo of AIFF chief Kalyan Chaubey. (ANI)





It was a busy day at the Football House in New Delhi as the All India Football Federation (AIFF) convened back-to-back meetings with multiple stakeholders in order to address the current predicament facing Indian football.AIFF called for interactions on short notice with Executive Committee members, Indian Super League (ISL) captains, club CEOs and I-League owners on Wednesday (November 12). ISL clubs and captains - except that of Mohun Bagan Super Giant and East Bengal - explored the possibility of putting in all their resources to make the top-tier tournament happen.Eight I-League clubs, meanwhile, stayed away from the meeting and are due to meet Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday.“Keeping in mind the fundamental importance of a multi- tier league National structure for the development of the football in the country (Tier 1-2-3), we suggest that all the three leagues in this case ISL, I League and I League-2 should be managed by one common league partner. This shall ensure long term holistic growth and sustainability to the National league ecosystem of the country,” the I-League clubs reportedly wrote to AIFF deputy secretary general M Satyanarayan.I-League clubs gave AIFF the ultimatum of announcing the new season in the next 10 days with kick-off by December 15 and not later than January 5, 2026 with matches to be broadcast live on two of the biggest properties - Star Sports and JioHotstar; Sony Sports Network and SonyLiv.AIFF had asked for all the stakeholders to join in consecutive meetings on less than three-hour notice. The desperate move was necessitated by the impending Supreme Court hearing where Chairperson of the Bid Evaluation Committee, Justice (Retd.) L. Nageswara Rao, is due to brief the court on the current situation in Indian football. On November 7, AIFF's attempt to attract bids for the commercial rights found no takers.
Article Summary: The All India Football Federation (AIFF) convened back-to-back meetings with multiple stakeholders in order to address the current predicament facing Indian football. Article Title: Indian football’s crisis: AIFF Super Cup semifinalists to play on, for now, despite an unclear future
Article Text:
East Bengal players in a huddle. (Twitter | @eastbengal_fc)

New Delhi:

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

TimesofIndia.com

Poll Should the AIFF take immediate action to secure the future of Indian football? Yes, it's urgent. No, let the current situation play out.





Three of India's top football clubs have halted operations amid the uncertainty over the future of the sport in the country. Kerala Blasters , Mohun Bagan Super Giant and Odisha FC have all suspended operations of their first teams. For the four teams that remain in the AIFF Super Cup, it is going to be business as usual - for now.East Bengal, Punjab FC, FC Goa and Mumbai City FC will play their AIFF Super Cup semi-finals on December 4 and 5 with the final on December 7. All matches will be played at the Fatorda Stadium in Goa.Sources within Punjab FC and Mumbai City FC have confirmed tothat the players have been given an extended break since their last encounter. Mumbai City FC last played on November 6 against Kerala Blasters and Punjab FC's last fixture came against Bengaluru FC on November 5.A Punjab FC insider revealed the players are due to report back for training on November 14. Mumbai City FC, meanwhile, confirmed that it is "business as usual for now."FC Goa players and staff are also due to return on November 14, a club official confirmed. Before the AIFF Super Cup semi-final, they will take on Iraq's Al Zawraa SC in the AFC Champions League Two on November 26.So, they will focus on the continental tournament "independent of what is happening in Indian football."Beyond the three teams that have stopped operations, Chennaiyin FC have told their players they're unsure of when the training will resume; NorthEast United have given players an extended break and Odisha FC are yet to get their pre-season underway.The period of uncertainty has been brought on since AIFF's tender to sell the commercial rights of the Indian Super League (ISL) found no bidders. The deadline to bid for the rights came once (November 5) and then again but eventually saw no interest by 5 pm on November 7.On Sunday, the bid evaluation committee comprising AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey, former SC Justice L. Nageswara Rao and Asian Football Confederation's (AFC) Kesvaran Murugasu met and stated their response will be submitted in the Supreme Court as part of the process.The unprecedent situation has been brought on with Football Sports Development Limited (FSDL) and AIFF not extending their agreement that ends on December 8. When the football federation put the tender publicly, four bidders showed initial interest, before pulling out as request for proposal (RFP) wasn't considered to be "commercially viable."Meanwhile, with the season in serious threat and their livelihoods on the line, the players came together as one.“To put it simply,” said the players in a statement that was later shared on social media, “we want to play, and now.”“This is a plea to all those involved in running our sport in the country, to do whatever it takes to get the football season underway,” the statement read.“India needs its competitive football now more than ever. As for us, we remain committed, professional and ready to walk out of that tunnel and onto the pitch the moment we're told we can. All we ask of those running our beautiful game, to match our desperation with honest intent. We've found ourselves in a very dark tunnel for long. We could do with a little light.”The statement was shared by some of Indian football's biggest names - Sunil Chhetri, Sandesh Jhingan, Gurpreet Singh Sandhu, Rahul Bheke, Lallianzuala Chhangte. The foreign players, too, followed suit.
Article Summary: Three of India's top football clubs have halted operations amid uncertainty over the future of the sport in the country. Kerala Blasters, Mohun Bagan Super Giant and Odisha FC have all suspended operations of their first teams. Four teams that remain in the AIFF Super Cup, it is going to be business as usual - for now.

Article Title: Arizona Cardinals melt down again as ‘real tough’ QB sets an NFL record no one wanted
Article Text:
Jacoby Brissett sets an NFL record in a 41-22 loss as the Cardinals collapse around him. (Image via Getty)

Jacoby Brissett’s record day meant nothing to him and everything about the Cardinals’ direction

The 49ers controlled everything while Kyle Shanahan praised Brissett’s toughness





The Arizona Cardinals found a new way to lose on Sunday, and Jacoby Brissett ended up holding an NFL record he wanted nothing to do with. The veteran quarterback completed 47 passes in a 41-22 loss to the San Francisco 49ers, setting a new single-game regular-season completions record while Arizona fell to 3-7 and unraveled under 17 penalties.Brissett threw for a career-high 452 yards, but his reaction said everything about the state of the team. “Man, I’ll throw for three yards and win right now,” he said. The Cardinals have dropped four of his five starts since Kyler Murray’s foot injury, and the numbers stopped mattering the moment the scoreboard tilted out of reach.Brissett set the new NFL mark with 47 completions, passing Drew Bledsoe’s 45 from 1994 and Jared Goff’s 45 in 2019. His performance powered massive days for Michael Wilson, who caught 15 passes for 185 yards, and Trey McBride, who added 115 yards and a touchdown.None of it translated to anything meaningful. Arizona played from behind almost instantly after San Francisco returned the opening kickoff to the 1 and scored on the next snap. The Cardinals followed it with repeated mistakes, including a franchise-record 17 penalties.For a team that talked all week about playing clean football, it was another step backward.Even Jonathan Gannon knew his quarterback would not care about the milestone. The head coach said he did not expect Brissett to be thrilled, and he was right. “I promise you man, I can care less about that part of it,” Brissett said. “Man, I hope somebody breaks it tomorrow or whenever. I mean, I just want to win.”Brissett has averaged 314 passing yards across his five starts, but the Cardinals have nothing to show for it except his name in the record book. He said the 3-7 team still “have the opportunity to wake up,” but Arizona is running out of time.The 49ers barely broke a sweat. Brock Purdy returned from a toe injury and threw three touchdown passes while Christian McCaffrey scored three times and extended his own NFL history streak with a game featuring a rushing and receiving touchdown. The 49ers jumped to a 25-10 halftime lead and never lost control.San Francisco head coach Kyle Shanahan learned about Brissett’s record only after the game but said the performance matched what he saw in real time. “I’ve got a lot of respect for Jacoby every time we played him,” Shanahan said. “He made a few of those big throws down the field where we were hitting him as he let it go and he hung in there. Real tough player and I got a lot of respect for him.”The Cardinals did not give themselves much of a chance. A long Bam Knight touchdown was wiped out by a holding penalty, Eddy Piñeiro hit a 47-yard field goal only after Arizona gifted him a second attempt, and key injuries struck throughout the afternoon. Brissett was again forced to carry an offense missing Marvin Harrison Jr., who was inactive after appendicitis surgery earlier in the week.Arizona now hosts Jacksonville next Sunday, and Brissett will have another chance to lead an offense that keeps putting up numbers without winning games. The record will follow him, but it is not the one he wanted.
Article Summary: Jacoby Brissett completed 47 passes in a 41-22 loss to the San Francisco 49ers. The veteran quarterback set a new single-game regular-season completions record. Arizona fell to 3-7 and unraveled under a franchise-record 17 penalties.

Article Title: Aaron Rodgers injury update: Will Steelers' veteran QB miss week 12 game against Chicago Bears as fracture concerns escalate
Article Text:
Aaron Rodgers injury update (Getty Images)

Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers injury update brings mixed early news



More NFL coverage





Pittsburgh felt the tension rise the moment Aaron Rodgers hit the ground against the Cincinnati Bengals. The veteran quarterback went down in the second quarter when several defenders closed in on him, sending him hard to the turf on his left wrist. Moments later, he entered the blue medical tent, and the Steelers announced he was questionable to return. By halftime, that hope faded. Mason Rudolph stepped in, and Rodgers was ruled out for the rest of the game.As the team celebrated a 34-12 win, attention quickly shifted to the injury. Early scans brought a mix of relief and concern. The problem is real, but the situation does not look long-term. The Steelers now wait for Monday’s testing to know exactly what they face.Initial X-rays revealed a small fracture in Rodgers’ left, non-throwing wrist, which explains the pain that forced him out. NFL insider Tom Pelissero reported, "Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers will undergo more tests Monday on his left wrist, but the initial belief is it’s nothing long term, sources tell me and @RapSheet. X-rays at the stadium showed a small fracture. They won’t know more until further scans." The team hopes the follow-up evaluation will confirm that the fracture is minor and manageable.ESPN added that Rodgers may be dealing with "a slight break" and that Mason Rudolph is expected to start in Week 12 against the Bears. Adam Schefter noted that Monday’s tests will help build a clear recovery timetable. Rodgers is said to be optimistic, and insiders Ian Rapoport and Pelissero echoed that he does not expect an extended absence.Still, his long-awaited return to Soldier Field now looks doubtful. The fracture could keep him sidelined when the Steelers travel to Chicago on Nov. 23. It would mean Bears fans miss a familiar face who dominated their team for years. Rodgers went 25-5 against them and delivered one of the most memorable moments in the rivalry when he shouted, “All my [bleeping] life, I own you. I own you. I still own you.”His future also hangs in the balance. Rodgers, 41, has said he is “pretty sure” this will be his last season. He chose Pittsburgh partly because the schedule offered another trip to Chicago. “I love Chicago, though — way more than they love me,” he said in May. “It’s been a great relationship — all one way.”For now, the Steelers wait, the division tightens, and Rudolph prepares to lead until Rodgers can return.
Article Summary: Aaron Rodgers went down in the second quarter against the Cincinnati Bengals. X-rays revealed a small fracture in Rodgers' left, non-throwing wrist. The team hopes the follow-up evaluation will confirm that the fracture is minor and manageable.

Article Title: Who is A.J. Brown’s fiancée Kelsey Riley? Everything you need to know about the Eagles WR’s love life
Article Text:
Who Is A.J. Brown’s Fiancée Kelsey Riley? (Getty Images and Instagram)

A.J. Brown found a forever teammate in his fiancée, Kelsey Riley



More NFL coverage





A.J. Brown and Kelsey Riley reached a new milestone in 2025, and their moment felt as heartfelt as their journey. After more than three years together, Brown chose a quiet but powerful way to honor the woman who has stood by him. Their children watched the moment unfold, making the celebration even more meaningful for the family. It marked the start of a new chapter that came soon after the Philadelphia Eagles lifted the 2025 Super Bowl trophy.Brown has always spoken openly about his priorities, even as his football career continues to rise. That’s what’s important to me — and my daughter, my son, my girlfriend.” His words offered a rare glimpse into how he balances success, responsibility and love.Kelsey Riley’s story begins in Louisiana, where she was born in August 1997 and raised in Belle Chasse. She was also a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha. Beyond athletics, Riley built a career in the medical field. Her LinkedIn lists roles in patient access at St. Luke’s Medical Center and earlier work in a hotel, a nursing home and freelance care coordination. Later that year, they welcomed their son, Arthur Juan Brown Jr., on September 29, 2022. Riley often shared glimpses of their growing family, including a photo with their newborn on the field after the Eagles won the NFC Championship in 2023. Brown is also father to his daughter, Jersee, born in May 2020.Their engagement arrived three months after Brown earned his Super Bowl ring. In May 2025, the couple revealed the proposal video, and John Legend commented, "Congratulations to you both. Thank you for including me." With the Eagles starting the 2025 season at 4-2 and questions swirling about Brown’s future role, one thing remains steady. His home team is already set, and Riley is at the center of it.
Article Summary: A.J. Brown and Kelsey Riley have been together for more than three years. He proposed at the Four Seasons in Philadelphia while John Legend sang "You and I (Nobody in the World)" Their children watched the moment unfold, making the celebration even more meaningful for the family.

Article Title: Who is Andy Reid's wife? Everything you need to know about Chiefs coach's life partner Tammy Reid
Article Text:
Who is Andy Reid’s wife (Getty Images)

Who is Andy Reid’s wife, Tammy?



Andy Reid’s wife, Tammy (Getty Images)

More NFL coverage





Andy Reid has firmly established himself as a veteran NFL coach who has guided many teams to victory, but the person who has stood with him the longest is his wife, Tammy. Her presence has shaped much of his personal life and career. Long before Kansas City celebrated championships under his leadership, the couple built a bond rooted in friendship, shared faith and quiet resilience. Their story is not only about football, but about two people choosing each other every day through wins, losses, grief and growth. As Tammy once said, their relationship works because they move through life as a team, always trusting the other.Their partnership began long before Andy held a play sheet on the sidelines. They met at Brigham Young University, living the normal, chaotic rhythm of college life. Neither imagined they would eventually build a family that spanned five children, several states and a demanding coaching career. Yet as the years unfolded, Tammy became the steady voice behind one of the NFL’s most successful coaches, offering encouragement whether things looked bright or bleak.Tammy Reid was born on November 6, 1959, and spent her childhood between New York, Memphis and Arizona.She later returned to her alma mater, Brigham Young University, as a physics professor. Beyond academics, she has spent years supporting Laurel House, an anti-domestic violence organization she feels deeply connected to. “I knew that Laurel House was something I could pour my heart into because I am married to one of the greatest men in the world,” she said about her work.Her admiration for Andy is something she expresses openly. She once told The Times Herald, “Andrew’s my best friend and we make a great team. I wish every woman could have the kind of loving, supportive relationship we have.” She has also stood behind him during the toughest stretches of coaching life, adding, “Maybe people don’t know this about me but I’m a very positive person and I have the ultimate trust in Andrew as a coach. No matter how bleak it looks, I always believe Andrew and his guys will figure out a way to do it.”Their first meeting at BYU came during a Fundamentals of Tennis class. Tammy noticed Andy’s confidence, though he refused to ask her out. She later laughed about how she pushed him to finally make a move. “He had this air about him, this confidence…but he wouldn’t ask me out,” she remembered. Their first date came after a competitive streak of tennis, badminton and racquetball. “Even though I’m really good, he killed me,” she admitted.The couple married on August 8, 1981, and went on to welcome five children. Their journey has included heartbreak. Their eldest son Garrett died of a heroin overdose in 2012. Andy shared at the time, “Words cannot express our sense of loss.” The family leaned on faith, football and each other to move forward.Today, as Andy continues leading the Kansas City Chiefs, Tammy remains the quiet anchor beside him. He still calls her his girlfriend, reminding everyone that love, like football, thrives when nurtured daily.
Article Summary: Tammy Reid is the wife of Kansas City Chiefs coach Andy Reid. The couple met at Brigham Young University and married in 1981. She has spent years supporting Laurel House, an anti-domestic violence organization. Their story is not only about football, but about two people choosing each other every day.
